1185.description: b'Kevin walked into the kitchen while Sarah headed to the folder. Kevin grabbed a carrot as Sarah picked up some notes. Kevin walked to the fridge while Sarah grabbed the folder. Kevin opened the fridge as Sarah walked to the bathroom. Kevin put the carrot in the fridge while Sarah moved to the kitchen. Kevin then walked to the kitchen cabinet and asked, "Could you possibly tell me where the beer and potatoes are?" Sarah replied, "The beer is inside the kitchen cabinet, along with a potato. There\'s also a potato hiding in the bathroom cabinet, another one in the cabinet in the bedroom, and yet another one in the kitchen cabinet. Yup, potatoes everywhere!"\n\nKevin opened the kitchen cabinet while Sarah put the folder on the kitchen table. Kevin then walked to another kitchen cabinet as Sarah placed the notes on the kitchen table. Kevin opened the second kitchen cabinet while Sarah walked to the bedroom. Kevin grabbed a potato as Sarah walked to the folder. Kevin walked to the fridge while Sarah grabbed the folder. Kevin put the potato in the fridge as Sarah walked to the kitchen. Kevin then walked to the living room while Sarah put the folder on the kitchen table. Kevin grabbed a beer while Sarah walked to the living room. Kevin walked back to the kitchen as Sarah grabbed some notes. Kevin walked to the fridge while Sarah walked to the kitchen. Kevin put the beer in the fridge as Sarah placed the notes on the kitchen table.'

questions.1:
Given the above interaction, if Sarah wants to hinder Kevin from achieving his goal, which of the following locations did Sarah least likely believe the beer was located when giving information?
    A) Coffee table
    B) Fridge
    C) Kitchen cabinet
questions.2:
Given the above interaction, if Sarah wants to hinder Kevin from achieving his goal, which of the following objects did Sarah least likely believe was located inside the kitchen cabinet when giving information?
    A) Beer
    B) Carrot
    C) Potato
questions.3:
Given the above interaction, assuming that Sarah believes that the beer is inside the kitchen cabinet, when giving information, Sarah is most likely:
    A) Trying to help
    B) Trying to hinder
    C) Neither trying to help nor hinder
questions.4:
Given the above interaction, assuming that Sarah believes that there is nothing worthwhile inside the kitchen cabinet, when giving information, Sarah is most likely:
    A) Trying to help
    B) Trying to hinder
    C) Neither trying to help nor hinder
questions.5:
Given the above interaction, assuming that Sarah believes the potatoes are only in the microwave, when giving information, Sarah is most likely:
    A) Trying to help
    B) Trying to hinder
    C) Neither trying to help nor hinder
